climbs.name: Trinity Crack
climbs.fa: FFA by Jon Stewart and Kevin Rauch, 5/26/05

content.description:
This is the crack system to the right of Carrots for Everyone and to the left of Kamikaze. The start is just left of the old tree. Proceed up some ledges before entering the middle section of the climb on the left-hand side of the gully. This part is sub-par in quality but is bolt protected. Higher is a final series of cracks and bulges which are quite fun. Save some gear for the very top.

NOTE:

A 60m rope might or might not safely get you down. Knot your ends.
content.location: Just left of the old tree, between Carrots and Kamikaze

climbs.name: There & Back Again
climbs.fa: FFA 9/21/05 by Kevin Rauch et. al.

content.description: There & Back Again is the steep prow to the right of May Day.  It isn't a very aesthetic line but the climbing is quite fun.  Somewhat neglected though I'm not sure why.

climbs.name: May Day
climbs.fa: FFA 5/6/05 by Kevin Rauch & Kevin Evansen

content.description:
Follow bolts up a dihedral to a ledge.  Great movement off the ledge leads to a bulge.  This leads to a beautiful but short arete.  This is one of my favorite routes at Ozone so far!

There is a TR variation to this route called SOS. Angle up under the roof to the left of the flakes/bolts on the first half. Pull up through the roof on small edges with powerful moves. Probably 5.11b and well worth doing!

(Do not bolt the variation)
content.location: Starts in dihedral about 15 feet right of the old tree

content.description:
"From base of the old tree, head up the slab and into a chimney squeeze. Once on the ledge, head left into the dihedral (optional gear protects easy climbing to next bolt) and then back onto the arete. The route has a heady crux getting onto the arete and a pleasant finish."

- 2008 Ozone Guidebook
content.location: Fourth anchor on this wall, climbing starts to the left of the tree. Shares anchor with May Day, bolt line to the right.

content.description: Climb to a high first bolt, then follow jugs over a few bulges to the anchor.
content.protection: Sport. The first bolt is very high (25ish feet). The runout to the first bolt can be protected with a half inch cam. However, these moves are fairly easy and secure.

climbs.name: Carrot Top
climbs.fa: Kevin Evansen, Sara Teegarden, Andreu Ferrero October 2020

content.description: Extension of Carrots for everyone to nearly the top of the cliff. Clip an extended runner to the anchor for Carrots for everyone and move left and up steep terrain on good jugs. Clip two bolts to gain a huge ledge, clip another bolt and step left to make the final moves to the anchor.
